formElement.documentation: Optional, S for standard, I for incidental, or E for emergency. Default value of S.
formElement.label: Change Type:

formElement.documentation: Optional, I for immediate execution or at start date/time, H to create request in hold. Default is I.
formElement.label: Execution Status:

formElement.documentation: Required, see ISPW administrator for valid values.
formElement.label: Runtime Configuration:

formElement.documentation: Optional, if checked, this will use the automatic deploy if that has been set up by the ISPW administrator, otherwise it defaults to not doing auto-deploy.
formElement.label: Auto-Deploy:

formElement.documentation: Optional, global custom headers used for all callbacks. Use "Header=Value" format.
formElement.label: HTTP Headers in format: "Header=Value":

formElement.documentation: Optional, global overide credentials used for all callbacks.
formElement.label: Global Credentials for Callbacks:

formElement.documentation: Event array, should contain at least 1 member. Uses JSON format, described in Compuware ISPW REST API Guide. Useful values can be found in /plugins/EC-ISPW/project/ec_callback_job etc. If this parameter is left empty, the plugin procedure will handle the callback itself, and the procedure call will then be synchronous: it won't return until a callback is received (or it times out).
formElement.label: Event array in JSON format for asynchronous callback:

formElement.documentation: Results will be saved into this property/property sheet.
formElement.label: Property sheet name for results:
